channel.title: Comments for Andrew Morgan on Databases
channel.description: Database technologies - especially around scalability and High Availability

item.title: Comment on MySQL Cluster running on Raspberry Pi by Mikael Ronström
item.dc:creator: Mikael Ronström
item.description:
In reply to <a href="./../mysql-cluster/mysql-cluster-running-on-raspberry-pi/index.html#comment-659345">changs</a>.
MySQL Cluster 8.0.18 now compiles on ARM CPUs and there is a community version for ARM on Red Hat.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to changs.

MySQL Cluster 8.0.18 now compiles on ARM CPUs and there is a
community version for ARM on Red Hat.

item.title: Comment on Setting up MySQL Asynchronous Replication for High Availability by andrew
item.dc:creator: andrew
item.description:
In reply to <a href="./../mysql-cluster/setting-up-mysql-asynchronous-replication-for-high-availability/index.html#comment-668713">Betty</a>.
Yes, when the slave comes back online, it will start pulling all of the changes that happened on the master while it was away.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Betty.

Yes, when the slave comes back online, it will start pulling all of the changes that happened on the master while it was away.

item.title: Comment on Setting up MySQL Asynchronous Replication for High Availability by Betty
item.dc:creator: Betty
item.description: What happen if sometimes a slave is offline? Will replication continue working after that server online again? Thanks for explanation.
item.content:encoded:
What happen if sometimes a slave is offline?
Will replication continue working after that server online again?
Thanks for explanation.

item.title: Comment on Get MySQL Replication up and running in 5 minutes by Sai Krishnan
item.dc:creator: Sai Krishnan
item.description: Can you please tell me how do we bind our mysql server with two different Ip Adresses as u have mentioned above i am not able to do that
item.content:encoded: Can you please tell me how do we bind our mysql server with two different Ip Adresses as u have mentioned above i am not able to do that

item.title: Comment on Get MySQL Replication up and running in 5 minutes by Nayan
item.dc:creator: Nayan
item.description: Master.cnf and slave.cnf are separate files which present on two different computer? Can we test replication process with two separate systems which is connected to same LAN ?
item.content:encoded:
Master.cnf and slave.cnf are separate files which present on two different computer?
Can we test replication process with two separate systems which is connected to same LAN ?

item.title: Comment on MySQL Cluster running on Raspberry Pi by changs
item.dc:creator: changs
item.description:
In reply to <a href="./../mysql-cluster/mysql-cluster-running-on-raspberry-pi/index.html#comment-446383">Sebastian</a>.
Hi Sebastian I have the same error as you, 'rmb was not declared in this scope',could you tell me your solution? thank you very munch.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Sebastian.

Hi Sebastian
I have the same error as you, ‘rmb was not declared in this scope’,could you tell me your solution?
thank you very munch.

item.title: Comment on My first Cluster running on Windows by Kailas Gorane
item.dc:creator: Kailas Gorane
item.description:
Hi Andrew, I am referring to this tutorial to setup mySql cluster. But, sqlserver node is not coming up. Below is output from mgmt console -
[ndbd(NDB)] 2 node(s) id=2 @10.15.4.30 (mysql-5.7.17 ndb-7.5.5, Nodegroup: 0, *) id=3 @10.15.4.34 (mysql-5.7.17 ndb-7.5.5, Nodegroup: 0)
[ndb_mgmd(MGM)] 1 node(s) id=1 @10.15.4.48 (mysql-5.7.17 ndb-7.5.5)
[mysqld(API)] 2 node(s) id=4 (not connected, accepting connect from 10.15.4.36) id=5 (not connected, accepting connect from 10.15.4.47)
My config.ini file is configured as below-
[ndbd default] noofreplicas=2 [ndbd] hostname=10.15.4.30 NodeId=2 [ndbd] hostname=10.15.4.34 NodeId=3 [ndb_mgmd] NodeId = 1 hostname=10.15.4.48 DataDir=E:/mysqlcluster/cluster-logs #Directory of the management node Log files [mysqld] NodeId=4 hostname=10.15.4.36 [mysqld] NodeId=5 hostname=10.15.4.47
Below is the my.cnf file on 10.15.4.36 - [mysqld] ndb-nodeid=4 ndbcluster Ndb-connectstring=10.15.4.48 port=3306 server-id=3306
Could you please reply to this issue?
item.content:encoded:
Hi Andrew,
I am referring to this tutorial to setup mySql cluster. But, sqlserver node is not coming up. Below is output from mgmt console –

[ndbd(NDB)] 2 node(s)
id=2 @10.15.4.30 (mysql-5.7.17 ndb-7.5.5, Nodegroup: 0, *)
id=3 @10.15.4.34 (mysql-5.7.17 ndb-7.5.5, Nodegroup: 0)

[ndb_mgmd(MGM)] 1 node(s)
id=1 @10.15.4.48 (mysql-5.7.17 ndb-7.5.5)

[mysqld(API)] 2 node(s)
id=4 (not connected, accepting connect from 10.15.4.36)
id=5 (not connected, accepting connect from 10.15.4.47)

My config.ini file is configured as below-

[ndbd default]
noofreplicas=2
[ndbd]
hostname=10.15.4.30
NodeId=2
[ndbd]
hostname=10.15.4.34
NodeId=3
[ndb_mgmd]
NodeId = 1
hostname=10.15.4.48
DataDir=E:/mysqlcluster/cluster-logs #Directory of the management node Log files
[mysqld]
NodeId=4
hostname=10.15.4.36
[mysqld]
NodeId=5
hostname=10.15.4.47

Below is the my.cnf file on 10.15.4.36 –
[mysqld]
ndb-nodeid=4
ndbcluster
Ndb-connectstring=10.15.4.48
port=3306
server-id=3306

Could you please reply to this issue?

item.title: Comment on Deploying MySQL Cluster over multiple hosts by andrew
item.dc:creator: andrew
item.description:
In reply to <a href="./../mysql-cluster/deploying-mysql-cluster-over-multiple-hosts/index.html#comment-649679">Ahmet</a>.
Thanks for your question but I'm afraid that I no longer work for Oracle (I'm now working for MongoDB) and so am not current on MySQL technology. I'd suggest checking the <a href="http://forums.mysql.com/list.php?25" rel="nofollow">MySQL Cluster forum</a>.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Ahmet.

Thanks for your question but I’m afraid that I no longer work for Oracle (I’m now working for MongoDB) and so am not current on MySQL technology. I’d suggest checking the MySQL Cluster forum.
